result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Tremayne Epps

records.addlTxt:
HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE HANRAHAN. 

Parties advises need additional time for resolution. Parties agree upon next court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.

Defendant Antonio Tremayne Epps not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael F. Hart in court for Antonio Tremayne Epps.  Attorney Megan Newport for John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Defense to advise where defendant is being held for zoom apperance. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael F. Hart in court, defendant Antonio Tremayne Epps not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE HANRAHAN. Defense requests adjournment. State does not object. Court grants adjournment. Parties agreed upon next court date. Case adjourned for status on 7-20-2022 9:30 am in Br. 4.

Defense contacted court to advise in trial on another case in another county and unable to appear on 6-9-2022. Defense requesting additional time. State does not object. Case adjourned in Branch 4 for status on 7-7-2022 8:30 am.
Branch 4 down on 5-11-2022. Parties contacted to reschedule hearing. Parties agree upon new court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael F. Hart in court, defendant Antonio Tremayne Epps not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Tremayne Epps in court with Attorney Michael F. Hart; both appear by video.  Defendant Antonio Tremayne Epps in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 020533,
Payable Number: 989440,
Receipt Number: 22RP008626,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Antonio Tremayne Epps not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Antonio Tremayne Epps in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Antonio Tremayne Epps in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antonio Tremayne Epps appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
